sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumseh Larko with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The U.S. has ordered its embassy staff and their families to leave Ukraine and not travel to Russia as tensions continue to rise over Moscow's military build-up. The EU's Foreign Affairs Council will discuss the issue with the U.S. Secretary of State later.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The secret ballot to pick a president. Italian parliamentarians choose their next head of state while Silvio Berlusconi drops out of the race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And the world of fashion pays tribute to the French designer Thierry Mugler, who's died at the age of 73.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The US is working hard to bring together its allies in the face of what they say is a likely invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But there are some cracks in old friendships beginning to show.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The head of the German Navy was forced to resign following his pro-Putin statements during a speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: First, we've been very clear that if there is any further Russian aggression in terms of sending Russian forces into Ukraine, there will be a swift, there will be a severe, and there will be a united response. further Russian aggression in terms of sending Russian forces into Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There will be a swift, there will be a severe and there will be a united response.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With the threat of war rising, the U.S. is evacuating families of personnel stationed in the Ukrainian embassy and it has advised U.S. citizens against traveling to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, EU ministers will meet on Monday to find common ground amid the rising tensions on the bloc's borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We will prepare for a difficult situation, have a menu, if I may say so, of sanctions, but the Europeans must be ready at any time to do so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The UK is on the hardliner side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: London accused Russia of planning to install a pro-Russia leader in Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And we're saying really two things.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: First of all, Ukraine is a free country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Under international law, it should decide its own fate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We will support them in defending themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But also to the international community, European, NATO allies, the U.S., we're standing shoulder to shoulder, saying there will be very serious consequences if Russia takes this move to try and invade but also install a puppet regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow denies the accusation and says the UK is circulating disinformation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While international diplomacy has been on overdrive to stop a war, Ukrainians on the ground are doing everything they can to prepare for a fight the pandemic could soon be over that's according to the regional director of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: the world health organization europe hans kruger says he sees kovi19 transformed to a seasonal disease in the months to come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So that once that the Omicron wave will subside, there will be for quite some weeks and months a global immunity, either thanks to the vaccine or because people have immunity due to the infection, omdat mensen immuniteit hebben door de infectie en ook een vermindering van de seizoen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dus we verwachten dat er een tijd van stilte zal zijn voor de COVID-19 kan terugkomen naar het einde van het jaar, maar niet nodig de pandemie terugkomen. coming back. So it's plausible that the region is moving towards a kind of a pandemic endgame, not an endgame of the COVID-19, but a pandemic endgame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In France, a new vaccine health passport begins today for those over the age of 16.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's despite protests in Paris at the weekend and political resistance. People will have to show them to enter bars, restaurants, gyms and inter-regional public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The past targets, the unvaccinated as a negative Covid test, will no longer be sufficient.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: However, coronavirus infections are surging through Poland. The country saw more than 34,000 new cases during the last 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This figure is an increase of 132 percent from last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Poland has a vaccination rate that is below the European Union average, with more than 21 million receiving their two doses. thousands of demonstrators in the u.s marched in washington dc against covet 19 restrictions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: the capital has adopted mask and vaccine mandates but president joe biden's plan to make the vaccine obligatory for all federal employees was recently shut down by the Supreme Court.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Belgium, police used water cannon and tear gas in the capital Brussels to disperse people protesting COVID-19 government restrictions. Police said the protests drew an estimated 50,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Liberty was the cry as the protesters marched and clashed with the police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In downtown Barcelona, signs read, it's not a pandemic it's a dictatorship as protesters there marched against restrictions imposed by both national and regional authorities police said over a thousand people attended with many not wearing a mask breaking Spain's covert 19 guidelines former Italian premier Silvio Berlusconi has been undergoing a series of medical examinations

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: in a Milan hospital. The 85-year-old recovered from Covid-19 in 2020 but has been in and out of hospital with complications connected to the infection ever since. He's also in a vulnerable group as he has a heart condition, which meant he had to have a pacemaker fitted several years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The government of Burkina Faso has called for calm after soldiers demanded improvements and support for their fight against Islamist militants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A curfew Sunday night was imposed to stop the rioting. Officials say talks will continue with the mutinying soldiers and deny that the army has seized power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Australian Open has been criticised for preventing fans from wearing Wears Peng Shui t-shirts during the tournament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Tennis legend Martina Navratilova called the decision by the event organisers to shut down support for the Chinese star pathetic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Peng Shui went missing after accusing a top Chinese official of sexual misconduct in November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Although she has reappeared, there are still concerns about her wellbeing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Inflation and the cost of living in the UK is causing more and more people to turn to food banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: According to one of Britain's biggest food bank networks, the Trussell Trust, a record 2.5 million parcels were given to people in crisis last year alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the six-year trend isn't any better.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Since 2015, the number of people needing help to obtain food has risen every year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Between 2020 and 2021, there was an increase of 33 percent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And the Trussell Trust says that 980,000 of those in need were children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Many are putting this rise down to the hike in fuel, energy and food prices, as well as the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But for many of those needing help, it's a first.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I think a lot of people in this situation who've never been in it before, I think I've been to a food bank once in my life and this is now my second.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I normally put something in the food bank trellis when I go shopping because, yeah, but now it's my turn to have to have some milk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There is definitely people who have got jobs, who are working, who because of the costs of living are so high now and their wages haven't gone up to meet those, then there are definitely more people who are working.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But there are people who've lost their jobs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The cost of living in Britain is forecast to soar higher in April, as a tax hike is expected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For now, the number of food bank users is not likely to drop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It was an open-air extravaganza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Lithuanian city of Konis marked the start of its programme as European Capital of Culture 2022 with ceremony and fanfare.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The main attraction was a spectacular light show with video projections, a kind of visual time travel through the history of Konis which wants to reinvent itself as a capital of culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Some 40,000 spectators attended despite freezing temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Lithuania we have a saying, Kaunas is Kaunas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Today I want to say it a bit differently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kaunas is culture, Lithuania's and Europe's culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dozens of festivals, exhibitions, events and concerts will take place in Kaunas over the next 12 months. This is Euronews Now. Time for us to take a break. We'll be back in a few moments.
